comments.body: Would drop the `skip` and replace with `noarch: python`.

I don't like `noarch` because byte code compilation is not optimized in conda. The installation of new environment can be dramatically slow down because of it. So I prefer to avoid using it.

Regarding `skip`, see reply to your first comment.
Well, 4 python files with all in all 779 lines of code, not a big deal having those compiled on environment creation. Noarch is also 1 CI run vs 2x3 CI runs (Python 3.6/3.7, win64, osx64, linux64).

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +11,15 @@
build:
  skip: True  # [py2k]
  number: 0
  script: "{{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . --no-deps -vv"
